description: This course covers advanced numerical simulation techniques used in computational physics and their application to several physical problems. Topics covered include the solution of few-body classical dynamics, quantum mechanical eigenproblems, Monte Carlo techniques, the Metropolis algorithm, and classical models of magnetism. The course will cover some topics in advanced C++ programming, including floating point numbers, vectorisation, optimisation, parallelisation, and debugging techniques. The course requires the use of C++, and this will be introduced from scratch.o cover some topics in advanced MATLAB programming, including vectorization, optimization, and debugging techniques.
prerequisites: Permission of Head of School + [PHYS3020 or PHYS7021] + [PHYS3040 or PHYS7042] +[ PHYS3051 or PHYS7250]
